meanings.definition: Having sharp, uneven edges or points
meanings.sent1: The jaggier rocks made it difficult to walk along the path.
meanings.sent2: The broken glass was much jaggier than the smooth pebbles.
meanings.sent3: The jaggier edges of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put them together.
meanings.sent4: Her jaggier personality clashed with his calm demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The jaggier mountain peaks pierced the sky like jagged teeth.

meanings.definition: To make something jagged or uneven
meanings.sent1: She carefully jaggied the paper to create a unique border for the card.
meanings.sent2: The artist jaggied the lines to give the drawing a more rugged look.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally jaggied the cake while trying to even out the frosting.
meanings.sent4: The storm jaggied the coastline, leaving behind a rough landscape.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor jaggied the clay into a striking sculpture of a jaguar.
